summary: Barbara L. Mosley was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). She appears in payroll and certification reports from April 1978 to December 1978. The documents list her as an employee, including her annual salary and gross pay for the specified periods. The documents do not specify her exact role within the committee, but her presence on payroll indicates she was a staff member.
significance: Barbara L. Mosley's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating her involvement in the investigation, though her specific role is not detailed in these documents.
